items.title: Chinese customs told to block H200 imports, report claims โ directive would effectively ban the Nvidia AI chip from China
items.summary: Chinese customs officers were allegedly told to disallow the entry of Nvidia H200 chips, effectively banning the entry of these AI processors into the country. The command comes as other sources say that Beijing will only allow the import of these AI GPUs for 'special circumstances.'

items.title: Beijing reportedly limiting H200 purchases to those with โspecial circumstancesโ โ sources suggest only university R&D labs can acquire Nvidia GPUs in China
items.summary: After weeks of deliberation, sources suggest that China will only allow companies to purchase H200 GPUs for "special circumstances," although Beijing has yet to define exactly what that means.

items.title: Deepseek research touts memory breakthrough, decoupling compute power and RAM pools to bypass GPU & HBM constraints โ Engram conditional memory module commits static knowledge to system RAM
items.summary: A new Deepseek whitepaper has outlined a new form of long-term memory for AI models, named Engram. Engram-based models are more performant than their MoE counterparts, and decouple compute power from system RAM pools to improve results.
